title: Too cold out? Snowed in? Winter activity ideas you can do at home
text:
Stuck inside this winter? Try these indoor winter activities at home
Mariyam Muhammad
Is the weather outside looking frightful? Ohio hasn't been spared from harsh weather, even though the official start of winter is still several days away. Has it been difficult to find things to do while you deal with lake-effect snow and frigid temperatures?
The winter season has begun — you either love it or hate it. Either way, you probably can’t spend too much time outside due to the low temperatures, harsh winds, and long nights.
But what you can do is snuggle up at home and find some cozy activities to do. Need some quick ideas? Check out this list and find what activity is perfect for your mood while you're stuck at home.
Do-it-yourself ideas to do at home in the winter
Want to get crafty while the snow falls? Here are a couple of ideas for getting creative.
- Make a
candle,soapor body butter in your favorite scent. - Learn how to knit or crochet a sweater or
blanket. - Make
DIY Christmas decorationsfor your home. - Grab a DIY kit of your choice from your local craft store.
- Learn how to
properly wrap your holiday presents.
Way to stay busy while you’re snowed in or it's too cold outside
Bored out of your mind while it’s snowing outside? Or is it too cold out there? Here are some random ideas to get you up on your feet.
- Clean out and organize your closet.
- Start learning to play a musical instrument.
- Go on an imaginary adventure and make a blanket fort with your kids (or by yourself).
- Change your bedding and reorganize your room.
- Have a game night with your family.
- Practice yoga or do a
workout class at home.
Unwind and relax while you're snowed in
Do you just want to forget about all the trials and tribulations in your life? Here's how you can relax the night away.
- Binge on a new show or watch a
classic Christmas movie. - Take a hot bath with a winter-themed bath bomb.
- Get cozy in bed with a good book or journal to write in.
Make a simmer potof some spices and fruits for a relaxing combination of scents.- Work on an adult coloring book.
- Listen to your favorite music playlist, podcast, or audiobook.
Baking and cooking ideas for when you’re snowed in
If there are some freezing temperatures outside, you know the drill—it’s time for a warm drink or hot meal. Here are a couple of ideas to warm up your heart from the cold.
- Bake some cookies, like
Taylor Swift’s chai cookie recipe. - Knead some dough and make a loaf of bread.
- Make homemade hot chocolate instead of using premade packets.
- Stir up some
butternut squash soupor white chicken chili. - Make some s’mores in your oven, air fryer, or tabletop fire pit.
- Try warm apple cider.
- Try out a dinner recipe you’ve been eyeing on social media.
